definition: to watch attentively/to fix one's attention on/to stare at/to gaze at
fourth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fourth in order/letter "D" or Roman "IV" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 195°/butyl/cubes (of food)
to watch sb closely/to breathe down sb's neck/to mark (sports)
to keep a close eye on sb (idiom)

sentences.english: Suddenly the giddiness is gone, and I stare at the ground.
sentences.chinese: 突然那种恍惚不见了，我盯着地面。

sentences.english: Then why do you look at the horse so carefully?
sentences.chinese: 那你为什么那么仔细的盯着我的马看？

sentences.english: You don't just have to sit in the stands and gape at the exploits of others.
sentences.chinese: 你大可不必坐在看台上，目瞪口呆地盯着别人的战绩。

sentences.english: You shouldn't always stare at others.
sentences.chinese: 你不要总是直瞪瞪地盯着人家看。

sentences.english: I stared at the bushes for a moment without seeing anything.
sentences.chinese: 我往那丛荆棘里盯了老半天，却什么也没看见。

sentences.english: Still he stared at me. Now his eyes were blank and looking through me.
sentences.chinese: 他仍然盯着我，他的眼光有些茫然，似乎不在看我。

sentences.english: I stared at the sheets of paper lying facedown on the printer.
sentences.chinese: 我盯着打印机里面朝下搁着的一摞纸。

sentences.english: Every pair of eyes was riveted on Mr. Mobley.
sentences.chinese: 所有人的眼睛当时都盯着莫雷先生。

sentences.english: Every year we gaze enviously at the lists of the richest people in world.
sentences.chinese: 每一年我们羡慕地盯着世界上最有钱的人名单。

sentences.english: Silence. Mulan stared out of the window deep in thought.
sentences.chinese: 穆兰沉默着，盯着窗外思索着。

sentences.english: Ron Artest doesn't read - he stares down books until they give up the information.
sentences.chinese: 阿泰不阅读，他盯着书，直到他们浮出字为止。

sentences.english: Write dull eyes still staring at the dark night to close the.
sentences.chinese: 写写乏味了双眼仍旧盯着漆黑的夜不肯合上。

sentences.english: Surrounding the Camaro, a group of pissed-off punks stared down at Jack.
sentences.chinese: 科迈罗车周围，一群小混混怒气冲冲地盯着杰克。

sentences.english: Quaritch stares at him through his breathing mask.
sentences.chinese: 夸里奇透过他的呼吸面罩盯着他。

sentences.english: My neighbor giggled in embarrassment, looking at the table like I did.
sentences.chinese: 我的邻座局促不安地傻笑着，跟我一样盯着桌子看。

sentences.english: Watch sb. as a cat watches a mouse.
sentences.chinese: 象猫盯耗子般地盯着某人。

definition: to watch sb closely/to breathe down sb's neck/to mark (sports)
to take aim/(fig.) to aim one's looks at/to glance at
to shoot a glance/glance/to appear in a flash
to run one's eyes over/to sweep one's eyes over
to open (one's eyes) wide/to stare at/to glare at
unable to take one's eyes off (idiom); to gaze steadily/to stare
to look at/to see/to see (a doctor)/to visit
to size sb up/to look sb up and down/to take the measure of/to suppose/to reckon
